intro: Beloperone fimbriata, commonly known as the fimbriate beloperone, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
